page.title: 18Coaley Mill
page.content: Coaley Mill is a water-powered mill. There has been a mill here since before 1300. Originally there were two small grist mills. From 1734 to 1944 it became an iron works making spades and shovels. When it was closed in 1944 it was taken over by two local farmers. Gradually the buildings decayed and the machinery was sold as scrap. In 1962 the site was taken over by its present owner. He demolished the old house and rebuilt it from new foundations. He renovated and extended the workshops. The present mill was built on the site of derilect buildings. In 1978 a water turbine was installed to generate electricity for the mill and the house. Today, the mill grinds grain and sells flour, hydro-electric and flour milling equipment.
